subclusters.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE formation, accumulation, and AGE-RAGE mediated inflammation causing tissue damage and systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes AGE accumulation as a fundamental aging process with AGE-RAGE signaling driving inflammation and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes AGE accumulation causing tissue damage and multisystem functional decline, with modifiability by diet and drugs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights AGE accumulation causing cardiovascular and renal aging pathology and prevention by AGE inhibitors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details non-enzymatic glycation, AGE formation, oxidative stress, and AGE-RAGE mediated tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE cross-linking in cardiovascular aging and therapeutic reversal by AGE cross-link breakers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes glycation-induced AGE cross-links in skin collagen causing extracellular matrix changes and skin aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on protein glycation and AGE accumulation in collagen and effects of dietary restriction on glycation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes AGE-induced transcriptional changes causing inflammation, matrix remodeling, oxidative stress, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE accumulation causing collagen cross-linking, oxidative stress, apoptosis, and tissue degeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes glycation as a deleterious modification enhanced by hyperglycemia causing oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details protein glycation and AGE accumulation causing tissue stiffening, inflammation, and cardiovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on extracellular matrix glycation crosslinks accumulation, mechanical stiffening, and therapeutic crosslink breakers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related acceleration of protein glycation (Maillard reaction) causing tissue protein dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE formation, oxidative stress, and cellular defense systems in skin aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glyoxalase Detoxification and AGE Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on glyoxalase system detoxifying AGE precursors, its age-related decline, and impact on AGE accumulation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes endogenous and dietary AGE sources, AGE receptor roles, and oxidative stress feedback in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details glycation-induced cross-linking in connective tissue proteins altering mechanics and cell-matrix interactions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on AGE cross-linking in cardiovascular ECM causing stiffness and receptor-mediated inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Glycation End Products (AGEs) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes AGE formation and cross-linking in arterial ECM causing stiffening and oxidative stress via AGE receptors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nonenzymatic Post-Translational Modifications (NEPTMs) Competition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on competition between glycation and carbamylation NEPTMs modifying collagen and matrix proteins in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Collagen Cross-Linking Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes enzymic and non-enzymic collagen cross-linking mechanisms and their impact on tissue mechanical properties.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Collagen Cross-Linking Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details enzymic lysyl oxidase and non-enzymic glycation cross-linking of collagen affecting turnover and mechanics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Non-Enzymic Post-Translational Modification (PTM) Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers broad non-enzymic PTMs including glycation, carbamylation, oxidation, racemization affecting protein structure and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Formaldehyde-Induced Protein Cross-Linking Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on formaldehyde-mediated protein cross-linking via Maillard reaction and its accumulation as aging biomarker.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Connective Tissue Aging via Genetic and Epigenetic Mechanisms
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genetic and epigenetic regulation of connective tissue aging including ECM modifications and cell-matrix signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Advanced Maillard Reaction-Derived Protein Cross-Linking Theory of Lens Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Maillard reaction-derived fluorescent cross-links (vesperlysine A) in lens aging and diabetic cataractogenesis.
